title: local folders
content:
I have many subfolders under Local Folders, and have been using popfile for years to sort my mail into the correct folder. But popfile is hasn't been supported for a long time and has stopped working for some of my email accounts. I created new pop3 accounts instead of using popfile's proxy to categorize the emails before they reach the inbox. Those pop3 accounts now have their own inboxes separate from the one under local folders and their own sets of message filters. I can use those message rules to move mail into the local folders, but I want to remove the popfile specific rules and use the same new non-popfile specific message filter for all accounts. instead of having to duplicate the message filters for each account.

Can all accounts be configured to use the local folders inbox and the same message filter? How? I have enabled the account column so I can tell which account received each message. It's been many years since I set up Thunderbird & I don't remember how I did it when Outlook Express went away. Can the junk filter be used to classify emails into more than junk/notjunk categories?
creator: Bill_Stuntz

title: Printing issue with attachments in Thunderbird
content:
Dear,

At our computer shop, we assist customers with their email, and for this, we always use Thunderbird.

However, this week we encountered a problem where printing was not working.

Both the printer and the computer are functioning properly. Printing from all other platforms works fine, even when we download the attachments and print them as PDFs.

The issue occurs when we open attachments directly in Thunderbird and then click on "Print." The print preview looks correct and shows the expected content, but the printer only produces two blank A4 pages.

We also tested the "Print to PDF" option, and that too results in two blank A4 pages being saved.

We’re very curious to know how we can resolve this issue or if this might be a small bug in the program?

The program is fully up to date, by the way.

Kind regards, Mike Papenburg
creator: m.papenburg

title: Nie działa wyszukiwanie w starszych wiadomościach
content:
Witajcie,

Proszę o pomoc z wyszukiwarką w programie Thunderbird 128.9.2esr (64 bity). Do tej pory wyszukiwarka działała poprawnie. Teraz gdy próbuje wyszukać jakieś hasło to wyszukiwarka pokazuje mi wyniki tylko od października 2024 do marca 2005 roku a wiadomości w folderach mam od 2020 roku. W ustawieniach pole Indeksowanie wiadomości i wyszukiwanie mam zaznaczone. Próbowałem odznaczyć i uruchomić program ponownie. Uruchamiałem też Thunderbird w trybie rozwiązywania problemów. Żadne z tych działań nie rozwiązało problemu. Jak wejdę w foldery na koncie to normalnie widzę wszystkie wiadomości od 2020 roku ale wyszukiwarka nie wyszukuje w wiadomościach przed 2024 rokiem. Co dokładnie powinienem zrobić aby to naprawić? Dziękuję za pomoc Pozdrawiam Marcin

title: Thunderbird, email not compliant with RFC, X-Mozilla-Keys, extra newline character
content:
I have a lots of emails stored in local folders but also some IMAP accounts configured in Thunderbird. OS: latest Ubuntu 24.10 Thunderbird: 128.9.1esr (64 bit) from snap

Recently I tried to move some emails from local mbox to Proton Mail (via their Proton Mail Bridge) running on the laptop. But I wasn't able to move the email. After some discussion with Proton support, it turns out that there is incompliant headers in the emails (see one of those emails full headers below). The X-Mozilla-Keys row is full of spaces, folllowed by newline character (^M). The following line start with ">>>>>>" and this is the reason why Proton Mail Bridge refuses to move this email to Proton account.

What is the problem? Thunderbird never complained about the email.

From - Wed Feb 12 10:20:14 2025^M X-Mozilla-Status: 0001^M X-Mozilla-Status2: 00000000^M X-Mozilla-Keys: ^M >>>>>>From bodlak@email.cz Tue Oct 2 21:48:26 2007^M Subject: Dotaz k =?ISO-8859-1?Q?placen=ED?= =?ISO-8859-1?Q?_pojistn=E9ho?=^M From: Martin =?ISO-8859-1?Q?Bodl=E1k?= <bodlak@email.cz>^M To: info@cnzp.cz^M Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8^M Message-Id: <1191354505.4792.39.camel@bodli.net>^M Mime-Version: 1.0^M X-Mailer: Evolution 2.10.3 (2.10.3-4.fc7) ^M Date: Tue, 02 Oct 2007 21:48:26 +0200^M X-Evolution-Format: text/plain^M X-Evolution-Account: 1161553920.12147.0@fedora.bodli.net^M X-Evolution-Transport: smtp://smtp.warnet.cz/;use_ssl=never^M X-Evolution-Fcc: mbox:/home/mbodlak/.evolution/mail/local#Sent^M X-Evolution-Source: local_mbox^M Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit^M
creator: martin.bodlak

title: ics file date-time fields seem to be misinterpreted by Thunderbird
content:
I get occasionally get ics files with content similar to this:

DTSTAMP:20250416T153158Z DTSTART:20250512T163000 DTEND:20250512T173000 SUMMARY:Appointment. DESCRIPTION:Date: 2025-05-12 Time: 04:30 PM

Note that the DTSTAMP property has the "Z" designator and is the correct UTC for when the ics file was created. However, the DTSTART and DTEND properties do not have "Z" and therefore should be interpreted as local time. Thunderbird appears to interpret them as UTC and convert them to the wrong local time in the calendar event.
creator: rschranz2
